snippet: The utility determined that disconnecting a feeder cable line had inadvertently caused a second cable to fail, prompting the problems on Metro-North Railroad’s New Haven line.
abstract: Consolidated Edison acknowledges that power loss that has left travelers on Metro-North Railroad’s New Haven line struggling for days is most likely related to the utility’s work disconnecting a feeder cable for service upgrades; utility expects to reconnect cable by Oct 7, allowing Metropolitan Transportation Authority to restore full service to line shortly after.

byline.original: By MATT FLEGENHEIMER and PATRICK McGEEHAN

lead_paragraph: The utility determined that disconnecting a feeder cable line had inadvertently caused a second cable to fail, prompting the problems on Metro-North Railroad’s New Haven line.

headline.main: Con Edison May Have Caused Metro-North Line’s Power Loss
headline.print_headline: Con Edison May Have Caused Metro-North Line’s Power Loss
